column5: My Uncle from back home (Newfoundland) sent me these pictures.  Simply incredible...I have seen over 500 moose...but never albino. The chances of seeing 1 albino is extremely rare.....but 2 on the same day....unbelievable.  Hope you enjoy these......  Jason
WOW AMAZING!!! thanks for sharing!  Gerritt.
I got those pics a while ago, very cool , I think the pics were taken near Algonquin park but not positive.
Wow, I have never seen nothing like that, until today! Thanks for sharing!   That's incredible.
nice to see they were shot with a camara... and not a rifle... just because they were an exceptional specimen.  Gerritt.
nice shots very cool to see them mom and dad saw one many moons ago but it was so far away the pics are not to clear I will pass these along to dad he will like them
Awesome pics of an incredible animal, I'm impressed regardless how many times I see these pics of these rare animals.  HF
wow interesting. I'm sure there are other things we humans haven't seen yet that are out there.
Those pictures were taken on HYW 101 halfway between Wawa and Chapleau Ontario as I recall. Have been seen a few times in that neck of the woods.
Cool pics... thanks for showing em
Never seen asn albino moose.   That's so cool.
WOW..  ..very cool pics,and yes they are very rare,can an albino moose be hunted legally,i hope not.....cheers

I beleive those pics where taking 1 hr from my house on highway 101 by foloyet.I was told by the groundhog river off the highway,  I could be wrong also, but thats story I keep hearing .  Here's a video film "supposly at the groundhog river bridge"  Quote:  LOOK A White Moose !! This is a white albino moose I filmed near Timmins Ontario Canada. This is the only white moose I've ever seen! CHECK IT OUT!! there is also a brown moose beside it.  http://www.metacafe.com/watch/376286/look_a_white_moose/   @Pam,  Maybe you know the whole story about those moose around out place
They aren't albino's. They are regular moose with a recessive gene.  Now you know
